page.title: 17Forestry
page.content:
At Grizedale we have the largest forest in the Lakes maintained by the{Forestry Commission.}
The trees are planted in Spring with a spade called a schlich. They will grow for approximately 50 years.
{ Sitka Spruce}is the main crop because this variety will grow on many soils. About 10% of the forest however comprises deciduous trees grown mainly on the lower slopes.
In different seasons the jobs carried out are planting, weeding, draining, felling, and fencing. The trees are felled with chainsaws and large machinery such as tractors and forwarders bring it the road side. Sub-contractors are employed to transport the timber away.
